column4: Hello... Where should I ask about starting an X session in a window and executing a shell script in it automatically?
What do you mean by starting an x session in a window?

I need to start an X session in a window. Xnest does this fine, however I am not sure how to then execute a shell script inside it. The shell scrip will execute GDM but must perform a few other tasks first
Is there any reason you can't just use an xterm?
Xnest is to be launched from another shell script and I can't get it to open xterm, I don't seem to be able to do anything in Xnest.
If I do "Xnest :22" and then "glxgears -display :22" it works, but I'm not sure how I can send a shell script to run inside there... I can't even send xterm into there
I think you need to change the $DISPLAY environment variable
thanks, I'll give it a go
Tell me if/how you get it working, I am curious :)
no luck. xterm has a parameter (-display) which sets the display. I get the same result with that parameter as I did with setting DISPLAY: "Xlib: connection to ":5.0" refused by server

never mind, I'm having a look at it... I'll let you know

But it let's you run a command at startup
does it? I can't find any good documentation on the internet or man pages etc
